intro: Chelonistele tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered chelonistele, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is a small shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
